intro: Spilotantha microsiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon spilotantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Spilotantha microsiphon is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
